text: hi it's angel welcome to tip toothpicks
where every Tuesday I share with you my
favorite home and kitchen tips now this
week's tip Tuesday I'm going to show you
my favorite way to cut a mango and while
there are many ways to cut mangoes this
is my favorite way because I feel like
it's the safest way and easiest way for
me to cut all the mango fruit off the
skin and see so with that let's get
started okay first things first we are
going to need a sharp knife a mango of
course and a vegetable peeler then with
your knife go ahead and call a top
portion of the mango just kind of a
sliver enough to make a flat surface and
the reason why we want to do that is so
that we can sit it down flat when we use
the vegetable peeler then you can
carefully go around with your vegetable
peeler and start peeling sides of the
mango so now that we have a perfectly
peeled mango we're going to go ahead and
put it back flat on the surface and
inside the mango there is a mango seed
or mango pit and it's kind of skinny and
tall so you want to go ahead and take
your knife then have vertically
outside the seat so now you have them in
your cheek that looks like this it's a
really nice juicy piece I'm going to go
ahead and do that to both sides and if
for some reason your knife hits the seat
that's okay just go ahead and move your
knife a little bit okay so two juicy
pieces I'm going to go ahead and cut
those first I like to cut mine up into
big pieces nothing fancy so I have large
pieces like this now if you're making
something like mango salsa you can go
ahead and dice up the mangoes into finer
cubes but these are nice big chunks
especially when they're ripe super good
okay now what we have left here is the
seed and there's still some heat on
there so I'm just gonna go ahead and cut
with my knife now that most of the mango
group is gone
we have two options here the first
option is to walk over to the sink and
just turn the light off as much as you
can or the second option is to use your
knife and cut away as much mango fruit
as you can
away from the sea and I'm going to do
the second option so you guys don't have
to watch me eat a mango seed that would
be really messy so that is it we should
have a mango seed that looks like this
just go ahead and toss that I don't
think we can plant that into a mango
tree but someone please correct me if
I'm wrong so now we have a big bowl of
freshly cut mangoes I find that this
mango getting technique is much easier
for me to use than the scoring technique
which some people also like so it's
totally personal preference but let me
know what you think in the comments
below and for more tip Tuesdays don't
forget to subscribe to my channel
angel lungs kitchen and I will see you
guys next time bye
